about.aboutContent:
The Mobile LIDAR Viewer Application is intended to be used to support PG&E Vegetation Management programs by empowering users to view and interrogate the results of mobile LIDAR data collection, extraction and analysis.

Widget Overview:
Legend: Provides a viewer with the symbology of every layer currently visible on the map
Layer List: Provides a list of every layer present in the application and the option to turn them on or off
Basemap Gallery: Allows a user to specify a different basemap, though Imagery with Labels is the default
Fullscreen: Allows a user to enter fullscreen mode
StreetSmart by CycloMedia: When zoomed in close enough on the map interface (when the Detection Point features begin to appear) this widget allows users to view and interact with the street level imagery collected by CycloMedia
Measurement: Allows a user to take length and area measurements in a specified unit
Add Data: Allows a user to add in geospatial data from another source to the application
Info Summary: Provides a user the full count of features of each layer that is currently on the map extent

Layers Overview:
Vegetation (Brush & Tree points): Two point features dsiplaying where trees and brush were extracted. Vegetation data was only captured where vegetation density was relatively low.
Electrical Distribution Assets (Pole Top & Pole Bottom points & Power Lines): Two point features describe an electrical distribution pole asset, one placed at the top and one at the bottom of the pole. The power lines are also extracted. These features help enrich the StreetSmart imagery for full user context of vegetation encroachment on assets.
Detection Points (Urgent, Overhang & Radial Detections): The detection points indicate lengths along the power line where CycloMedia's vegetation management tools detected that vegetation was within search parameters at that location. Those search parameters are: Urgent (within 4ft of a power line), Overhang (within a 4ft vertical plane of a power line), or Radial (within 12ft of a power line). These features help enrich the StreetSmart imagery for users to quickly and easily identify the source of vegetation encroachment on electrical distribution assets.
Detection Buffers (Urgent, Overhang & Radial Detections): These polygon features generalize the detection points described above into polygon areas. These features are intended to be viewed in a 2-dimensional map interface to understand where different encroachments occur along the length of assets.
Span Status: This line feature generalizes the length of the electrical distribution right of way into the lengths between two poles. Each of these spans are statused to summarize the detection the LIDAR tools have derived along that span.
Reference Data (Vegetation Management Regions, ED Circuit Lines): These miscellaneous layers provide users with more context about the PG&E management areas features occur in.
